citations.narrative:
There are accumulations of wet shavings, dirt, and debris by the water nipples, wire mesh surrounding the nipples, and
the PVC drainpipes below the water nipples to remove excess water while guinea pigs are drinking in three guinea pig
racks. Accumulations of wet shavings, dirt, and debris around the automatic water nipples and water drainpipes can
expose the guinea pigs to potential disease risks such as bacterial and fungal infections. Water receptacles such as
automatic delivery lines must be cleaned and sanitized whenever dirty and must be sanitized at least once every 2 weeks.
Inadequate cleaning and sanitation of the water nipples, wire mesh surrounding the water valves, and drainpipes can
result in contamination of the guinea pigs in the same enclosure and located in lower enclosures from those above.
Licensee must ensure water nipples, wire mesh surrounding the nipples, and drainpipes are kept clean and sanitized
when dirty. Correct by February 24, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
